title: From ‘Bond’ Set to Playboy Backdrop: A Famous Desert Home
text: THE ELROD HOUSE, a striking glass-and-concrete edifice, is wedged into a craggy hillside of California’s Sonoran Desert. Massive boulders jut in and out of the structure, window walls ensure panoramic desert views and a sunburst of skylights explodes from the center of its domed ceiling. Fifty years ago, interior designer Arthur Elrod (1924-1974) commissioned architect John Lautner to build this Palm Springs marvel as his home. It quickly became a bachelor-pad setting for films and photos as well the site of Mr. Elrod’s famously lavish parties. The Gatsby-like designer—who had emigrated from the family farm in South...
description: Glamorous designer Kelly Wearstler admires the grand-yet-intimate living room of a midcentury masterpiece in Palm Beach, decorated by Arthur Elrod.
